poem:
To Finish the Job

In the Tory vale,
where flag and tradition
once stood tall—
now, whispers of change,
like pollen in the breeze,
scatter seeds of blue
to yellow gold—
Ed's promise,
a gardener's hope,
in the morning soft light,
to till new earth,
and bloom
where once roots held
so tightly.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Lib Dems plan to ‘finish the job’ in Tory heartlands, says Ed Davey The Liberal Democrats plan to “finish the job” of eliminating the Conservatives from their traditional heartlands at the next election, Ed Davey has promised, saying a further move to the right by a new Tory leader would make this even more likely. In his first interview since the Lib Dems won 72 MPs in the general election, beyond party strategists’ highest predictions,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Lib Dems plan to ‘finish the job’ in Tory heartlands, says Ed Davey The Liberal Democrats plan to “finish the job” of eliminating the Conservatives from their traditional heartlands at the next election, Ed Davey has promised, saying a further move to the right by a new Tory leader would make this even more likely.
